sentences.english: Nothing was heard in the room but the hurrying pen of the stripling.
sentences.chinese: 屋子里悄然无声，只有年轻人的笔匆忙划过纸页。

sentences.english: Zhang Jingjing has been the face of silent tears fall quietly.
sentences.chinese: 张晶晶脸上无声的泪水已悄然滑落。

sentences.english: Changes have also occurred stealthily/quietly in recreational consumption during holiday seasons.
sentences.chinese: 从节假日购物消费来看，同样也在悄然发生着变化。

sentences.english: Everything is changing, fingertips, dream has far.
sentences.chinese: 一切都在悄然改变，弹指间，梦已远。

sentences.english: In the wake of the scandal, the senator's one-time adherents quietly deserted him.
sentences.chinese: 因为丑闻，该参议院昔日的追随者悄然弃他而去。

sentences.english: Is life passing us by as we keep our minds super-busy?
sentences.chinese: 当我们让思想如此繁忙时，生活是否悄然而过？

sentences.english: her mother died and her father followed.
sentences.chinese: 母亲辞世后不久，父亲也紧随其后，悄然离去。

sentences.english: If I passed away quietly someday, please bury me in the spring.
sentences.chinese: 如果有一天，我悄然离去，请把我埋在这春天里。

sentences.english: But a face-off may be looming.
sentences.chinese: 不过一场争论还是悄然临近了。

sentences.english: Time noiselessly once rowed in the self-discipline of seven Yans.
sentences.chinese: 时间，在七焰的修炼中悄然划过。

sentences.english: I am a tree with many branches, with fewer and fewer leaves on those branchlets each time you pass.
sentences.chinese: 一棵枝繁的树，在你悄然的身后，叶子片片凋零。

sentences.english: Slowly Yang rise face, companion wear neck, depend to go under the lips of quietly familiar Chuan village.
sentences.chinese: 慢慢仰起脸，伴着脖子，悄然熟川村的嘴唇下靠去。

sentences.english: Modern submarines are very, very quiet.
sentences.chinese: 现代潜艇的航行是悄然无声的。

sentences.english: With September comes a sense of autumn.
sentences.chinese: 九月悄然给我们捎来了一丝秋意。

sentences.english: Such a parallel universe is indeed emerging.
sentences.chinese: 这种平行世界确实在悄然兴起。

sentences.english: Tracking wild animals requires great stealth.
sentences.chinese: 跟踪野生动物必须悄然无声。

definition: on the eve of/to be about to/to be on the verge of
(of alcohol) to ferment/(of a crisis) to be brewing/to mull over (an issue)/to hold exploratory discussions
to progress (or increase, change etc) day by day/more (or better etc) with each passing day
